content: irish tartan pocket shawl designed by mary riley hunt yarn 7 skeins of cloudborn bulky merino wool or approximately 765 yards of bulky yarn color oatmeal heather needles and hooks usa size 11 8 mm circular knitting needles size h or i crochet hook gauge after blocking 12 stitches and 18 row = 4 inches finished measurement after blocking 63 ½ inches long and 19 inches wide notions tapestry needle measuring tape scissors stitches/abbreviations co cast on k knit p purl sm slip marker pm place marker ws wrong side bobble bind off sl slip st stitch ©2020 by mary riley hunt all rights reserved shawl chain chain directions using the long tail cast on method co 6 stitches pm co 45 stitches pm co 6 stitches 57 total stitches row 1 ws k1 p1 3 times sm p3 k3 p3 7 times sm p1 k1 3 times row 2 k1 p1 3 times sm k3 p3 7 times k3 sm p1 k1 3 times row 3 k1 p1 3 times sm p3 k3 p3 7 times sm p1 k1 3 times row 4 k1 p1 3 times sm k all stitches to the marker sm p1 k1 3 times row 5 k1 p1 3 times sm p all stitches to the marker sm p1 k1 3 times row 6 k1 p1 3 times sm k all stitches to the marker sm p1 k1 3 times 1 ©2020 by mary riley hunt all rights reserved - sales of finished shawl is allowed repeat row 1-6 44 more times or to the desired length slipping the markers as you come to them bobble block your scarf pockets make two co 21 row 1 ws p3 k3 p3 to the end of the row row 2 k3 p3 3 times k3 row 3 p3 k3 p3 to the end of the row row 4 k all stitches row 5 p all stitches row 6 k all stitches repeat row 1-6 4 more times pocket ribbing row 31 *p1 k1 repeat from * to last stitch p1 row 32 *k1 p1 repeat from * to last stitch k1 repeat row 31 and 32 2 more times bobble in pattern block your pockets before attaching them to the scarf position pockets about 2 inches from bottom of shawl and centered and whip stitch to shawl fringe if desired attach fringe of your choice i used the twisted crochet fringe with the right side of the shawl facing you and using either an h or i crochet hook whatever you have slip_stitch into the first cast on or bound off stitch depending on which end of the shawl you start on chain 1 *draw out a loop 13″ 33 02 cm long use a measuring tape to be consistent insert your index finger into the loop and twist loop 25 times note it does not matter which direction just be consistent using the crochet hook slip_stitch in same st allowing twisted loop to coil around
